The [UVA Library's](https://www.library.virginia.edu) [Research Data Services](https://data.library.virginia.edu) and [Data Services at the Health Sciences Library](https://guides.hsl.virginia.edu/data) teams are partnering with UVA's [PhDPlus program](http://phdplus.virginia.edu/) to present Data Science Essentials in R, a six-session series to build data analysis, wrangling, and visualization skills.

This site will host the materials for the series.

<br>
<br>

## When
* Dates: Wednesdays, 2/12, 2/19, 2/26, 3/4, 3/18, 3/25
* Time: 2:00 - 4:00 p.m.
* Place: TBD

## What

#### **Introduction to R**
Wednesday, 2/12   
Instructor: Jenn Huck

This session provides a gentle introduction to R and RStudio. We’ll get started navigating R with RStudio, loading libraries, and importing data. We’ll do some basic data manipulation, exploration, and analysis, and begin creating plots and graphics. 

- [Instruction](intror.html)   
- [Download materials](intro_to_R.zip) (Zip file)


#### **Exploratory Data Analysis **
Wednesday, 2/19   
Instructor: David Martin

#### **Data preparation**
Wednesday, 2/26   
Instructor: David Martin

#### **Data visualization**
Wednesday, 3/4    
Instructor: Clay Ford

#### **Everyday Statistics**
Wednesday, 3/18     
Instructor: Marieke Jones

#### **Linear Modeling**
Wednesday, 3/25    
Instructor: Clay Ford

The workshops will assume understanding of the material in the preceding sessions and will build on a common research case, using Albemarle Real Estate Property data (though each workshop may also introduce additional examples and data). 


## How
Register for the series through [PhD+ pages](https://phdplus.virginia.edu/core-module/data-literacy). You may register for individual sessions; if registration exceeds the registration cap (35), preference will be given to individuals who've signed up for the entire series.
